title: What is the relationship between male response and pupil size in aggressive behavior?
first_phrase: This text explores the connection between anger, fascination, and dominance in humans and animals. The author mentions how animals establish hierarchical dominance through aggressive behavior and how this behavior can also generate fascination in observers. The text references the work of researcher Michael Argyle to showcase how anger, aggressiveness, and attack behavior in animals and humans manifest in body language and muscle tension. Within the final 200 tokens, the author illustrates how a hypnotist named Virgilio T employs anger in his practice to evoke fascination in his subjects by inducing a similar level of muscle tension that is associated with attack behavior. This approach leads to the induction of a particular state of consciousness termed as the "zone."
